title: Britain’s Got Talent’s Simon Cowell dances to Stavros Flatley in Champions final
text:
Simon Cowell joined the judges for a dance, very briefly (Picture: ITV)

It’s fair to say Britain’s Got Talent’s Simon Cowell is a huge fan of Stavros Flatley, after he gave the dancing duo his golden buzzer, sending them straight through to the final.

And the notoriously hard to please judge proved just how much he loved the Greek performers, as he got up and danced during their performance.

Yes, seriously.

The 59-year-old got to his feet alongside fellow judges Amanda Holden, David Walliams and Alesha Dixon, showing off his best moves.

Okay, he didn’t quite match the ability or enthusiasm of finalists Semi Demetriou and son Lagi, choosing instead to sway slowly with the music, but he gave it a good go.

That’s what counts, right?

Don’t go for it too much, Simon (Picture: ITV)

Stavros Flatley first came to fame after taking part in Britain’s Got Talent, way back in 2009, finishing the show in fourth place.

And fans of the pair were thrown into meltdown after it was claimed they would be calling time on the act after the Champions final.

‘We’ve done this for 10 years for a joke,’ Demi told The Sun.

‘We’ve done so many things but what is there left to do? We’ve done the Royal Variety, we’ve played in China, Monaco – everywhere.

Stavros Flatley denied split claims (Picture: ITV)

‘So when we got to The Champions, I thought this was the right time to leave. But Simon Cowell told me not to quit forever. So I will return for some shows.’

However, they have now poured ice cold water on the claims, insisting they are definitely staying together.

Taking to Instagram, the comedy act shared a video of Demi locking himself in the toilet, asking his son whether or not they had split.

‘We’re not splitting up man,’ Lagi insisted before his dad shouted back: ‘I’m staying in here until you tell me for sure we haven’t split up.’

‘Course we know, we haven’t split up, would you just come out?’

Running out of the toilet, and then down the street, Demi yelled: ‘We haven’t split up, we haven’t split up, we haven’t split up.’
